Documentation

This page explains how to use SensorRecord.

Recording sensor data

Please follow the instructions below.
  • Set a fitting title for your trip, so that it\'s easier to find later
  • Press Start recording when you are seated in the aircraft
  • Press Add marker for each of these events:\n
    • Pushback (the aircraft leaves the gate)
    • Taxi (the aircraft starts driving toward the runway using its own engines. This happens after the aircraft has been stationary for a short while after pushback)
    • Takeoff (when the aircraft is on the runway and you hear the engines increase power, i.e., not when the aircraft lifts off, but when it starts accelerating)
    • Landing (the second the aircraft touches the ground again)
    • Park (when the aircraft stops at the gate)
  • Press Stop recording when you exit the aircraft\n
Add marker opens a dialog requesting a title and a confirmation (OK/Cancel). The timestamp is saved when Add marker is pressed, not when OK is pressed. Therefore, please press Add marker at the exact moment one of the listed events happen (takeoff, landing, etc.).

The app runs in the background, so you don\'t need to have it open except when you\'re adding a marker. It also displays a notification while running that, if pressed, opens the app for you.

Have a nice trip!

After your trip

Depending on the length of your recording, processing the data might take up to a minute. Please be patient.
  • Open the navigation drawer of the app by pressing the hamburger menu button in the top left corner
  • Select History
  • Click on your recording (listed as your_title.zip)
  • Use your preferred platform to share the file

Thank you!
